divs: sighting detailsduring the lunch hour, i saw a black cylinder in the sky about a mile away and about 1,500ft up. it was a tube-shaped object with rounded ends. studying it for about a minute through binoculars, i was sure it was not a helicopter or aircraft. it lacked wings, propellers, engines, lights, landing gear, windows, and it had no insignias. at no time did i hear sound from it. the object flew under power, but the source of it was not apparent. the wind had no apparent effect on it. i estimated the size at around 6 feet in diameter and up to 18 feet long. it changed compass directions with smooth on-axis turns. it rotated flat as if a pin was stuck down through its mid point. for the first turn it slowed and rotated about 45deg, pointing one of its ends in my direction and then flew straight toward my position. the second on-axis turn occurred when it was about 1\4 mile away from me. as part of that maneuver, one end rose upwards to about 60deg. the tube then flew as if following an upwardly diagonal straight line; it went toward a spot on the 2,200ft base of a thick overcast. while watching with binoculars the tube suddenly changed shape and became a black rectangular sheet with slightly ragged edges. now instead of a tube, there appeared something in the shape of a quite large sheet of plywood, painted black, roughly 8ft x 16ft. as if nothing had happened, the flying sheet kept the tube���s 60-degree tilt and silently continued along the same diagonal path. as it went the sheet slowly rocked side to side, perhaps 10 degrees each side; it was as if a spindle shaft went through the middle of it on the long dimension. the timing of the rocking movements did not seem to vary. at this point, by ground distance the object was roughly 1\2 mile away or a bit more. a patch of blue sky had appeared a few thousand feet above the flying sheet, actually at the 6,600ft roof of the overcast. still tilted and rocking, the sheet transitioned from its diagonal path to a 90deg straight-up climb toward the blue. a last look through the binoculars before the clouds closed over showed a pinpoint quite high in the open sky and moving straight away. the sighting lasted around 5 minutes.
Summary: Daytime - dark tubular object, Shape shift.
trends: There have been 158 other sightings in Portland
There were 2 other sightings in Portland on or around May 16th 2010
Object Flight Path: Path with directional change,Path then hovering,Other
